term.title: downconversion

item.text: Process by which a photon with frequencyν1 interacts with a non-linear medium and splits into two simultaneously emitted photons with frequencies ν2 and ν3 so that the energy is conserved:

notes.item: Also known as a parametric downconversion.

The efficiency of the conversion process depends on the parametric gain in the non-linear material. This in turn depends on the power of the incident radiation, the photon frequencies, their indices of refraction in the material, and the non-linear 'hyper-susceptibility' of the material.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 326 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
